intro: Randia scandens, commonly known as the creeping randia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit, with opposite leaves that are elliptical and slightly hairy. Its small, fragrant flowers are typically white or pale pink, and they appear in clusters along the stems. Randia scandens is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in humid, shaded environments.
